snippet.title: Wabbit - Apollo, October 1982
snippet.description:
Wabbit for the Atari VCS/2600, played on Game 5, difficulty switch at B. Wabbit was the sole game published by Apollo done by Van Tran, a developer who had pitched her managers on doing a game specifically for girls. In it, a little girl named Billie Sue throws projectiles at "wabbits" that are stealing her vegetables. When the wabbits reach 100 points, the player loses the game. Every time the player earns 100 points, the wabbits' score drops.

Upon completing Wabbit, Tran started work on a second title at Apollo, but the company closed before it was completed. She went on to work on an also-unreleased conversion of Solar Fox to the Atari 5200 at MicroGraphic Image.
